newsitem.title: USA: Late NYMEX Hub natgas scores more gains on weather.
newsitem.headline: Late NYMEX Hub natgas scores more gains on weather.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures continued to move higher late Monday in lackluster activity, powered by revised forecasts calling for mostly above-normal U.S. weather this week, industry sources said.
At 1405 EDT, August was up 5.6 cents at $2.15 per million British thermal units, while September was 3.6 cents higher at $2.14. Most others were up by one-half to 2.5 cents.

"Technically, I think we should be moving lower, but with cash holding firm and still over the screen, there's not much reason to sell it here," said one Texas-based trader, noting hot U.S. weather helped firm the cash today.

Chart traders said an August close above near-resistance at $2.15 could set up a test of key resistance along the down trendline in the $2.24 area. Support was still seen at last week's $2.051 low, with psychological buying likely at $2.

Heat and humidity are expected to plague the Northeast this week though levels should moderate some from the mid-90s F today. Temperatures in most other regions also were forecast at above-normal for the period.

In the cash Monday, Gulf Coast prices firmed two to three cents to the mid-teens. Midcon pipes were up a similar amount to the $2.05-06 area. New York city gate gas jumped more than a nickel to the mid-to-high $2.40s.
NYMEX said 12,009 contracts traded at 1340 EDT. Hub open interest on July 11 rose 434 contracts to 201,218.
On the KCBT, August climbed 4.8 cents to $2.04, while deferreds were still steady to three cents higher. The East/West spread widened by 0.8 cent to 11.0 cents (NYMEX premium).
